Detailed educational program for the third year of the Paris-Saclay CPES

Description of the challenges of the third year, etc.

Distribution of courses in L3

LIPPS 20%
ESR 80%
LIPPS : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay
ESR : Higher Education & Research Institutions

Course details for third year of CPES Paris-Saclay

Core fundamentals block
L3 21 ECTS
Mathematics 3
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 7 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 3 Period : Throughout the year Title : Mathematics 3 Duration : 30 weeks Course hours : 4 hours per week, 120 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures + Tutorials Credits : 7 ECTS
Course description

This third mathematics course offers an in-depth introduction to topology of normed vector spaces, duality and the study of quadratic and Hermitian forms. It also offers an introduction to differentiable optimization, as well as fundamental algebraic structures: groups, rings and fields.

Measures, integration, probabilities
ENS Paris-Saclay 3.5 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 3 Period : First semester Title : Measures, integration, probabilities Duration : 12 weeks Course hours : 3 hours per week, 36 hours per year Institution : ENS Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures + Tutorials Credits : 3.5 ECTS
Course description

This course introduces the foundations of measure theory and integration, with particular attention to the construction of sigma-algebras, the notion of measurability and the Lebesgue integral. It explores functional spaces and their properties, in connection with modern analysis tools.

Applications to probabilities (Kolmogorov axiomatics) illustrate the scope of these concepts in modeling random phenomena and in rigorous treatment of random variables.

Information theory, optimization
ENS Paris-Saclay 3.5 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 3 Period : Second semester Title : Information theory, optimization Duration : 12 weeks Course hours : 3 hours per week, 36 hours per year Institution : ENS Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures + Tutorials Credits : 3.5 ECTS
Course description

This course offers an introduction to signal theory, particularly the discrete Fourier transform and the Nyquist-Shannon theorem, which allow analysis and reconstruction of digital signals.

It then addresses the foundations of discrete optimization and convex optimization, with or without constraints, emphasizing analytical and algorithmic solution methods.

Ordinary differential equations
ENS Paris-Saclay 3.5 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 3 Period : First semester Title : Ordinary differential equations Duration : 12 weeks Course hours : 3 hours per week, 36 hours per year Institution : ENS Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures + Tutorials Credits : 3.5 ECTS
Course description

This course covers the resolution of ordinary differential equations (ODE) of order 1 and 2, as well as first-order linear differential systems and their extension to nth-order ODEs. It addresses the Cauchy-Lipschitz theorem, qualitative analysis of solutions and offers an introduction to stochastic differential equations (SDE).

The program provides essential knowledge for understanding and manipulating the main tools of differential analysis.

Databases
Paris-Saclay University 3.5 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 3 Period : Second semester Title : Databases Duration : 12 weeks Course hours : 3.5 hours per week, 42 hours per year Institution : Paris-Saclay University Teaching method : Lectures + Tutorials Credits : 3.5 ECTS
Course description

This course deepens the principles of using relational Database Management Systems (DBMS).

Integrity and Constraints

  • In-depth study of data models, updates and management of SQL and non-SQL constraints.

Procedural Programming (PL/SQL)

  • Learning PL/SQL language to automate processing through cursors, triggers and database exception and error handling.

Web Architecture and Program Mode

  • Interfacing between databases and web applications (Internet architecture, HTML, PHP). The course covers DBMS access issues in "program mode", level independence and data confidentiality (encapsulation).
Applied and specialization domains block
L3 21 ECTS
Introduction to clinical and epidemiological research
Paris-Saclay University 6 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 3 Period : Throughout the year Title : Introduction to clinical and epidemiological research Duration : 24 weeks Course hours : 4 hours per week, 96 hours per year Institution : Paris-Saclay University Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 6 ECTS
Course description

This introduction to clinical and epidemiological research presents the essential methodological foundations for designing, conducting and analyzing studies in public health and clinical settings. It covers key epidemiology principles, different types of observational and interventional studies, as well as statistical methods adapted to clinical data analysis.

Particular attention is paid to scientific rigor, research ethics and critical interpretation of results, with a practical approach favoring application of concepts in various biomedical contexts.

Economics, social policies and health
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 4 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 3 Period : Throughout the year Title : Economics, social policies and health Duration : 30 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 60 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 4 ECTS
Course description

This course analyzes the design and evaluation of public policies: who decides, with what objectives, and how to measure their effects using micro and macro-econometric tools. It also addresses behavioral economics applied to public policies and offers a critical assessment of interventions.

The second part explores economic and financial globalization: trade opening since the 19th century, international trade analysis, regionalization and governance, as well as the constitution and functioning of the global capital market.

Health Track
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 4 ECTS
Elective Year : Bachelor 3 Period : First semester Title : Health Track Duration : 30 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 60 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 4 ECTS
Course description

This module offers a multidisciplinary approach to understanding the fundamental mechanisms of living things.

Microbiology

  • Diversity of microorganisms (organization, ecology, metabolism), laboratory observation and culture.

Immunology

  • Roles of molecular and cellular actors of the immune system, vaccine strategies and antiviral principles.

Cell differentiation

  • Stem cell concept, differentiation stages and control (genetic, paracrine, hormonal), role in development and cell renewal.

Neurosciences

  • Anatomo-functional organization of the central and peripheral nervous system, complex functions (stress, motor skills), and pathologies, particularly neurodegenerative.
Society Track
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 4 ECTS
Elective Year : Bachelor 3 Period : Second semester Title : Society Track Duration : 30 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 60 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 4 ECTS
Course description

This module explores major contemporary issues through four key themes.

Sociology of risk

  • Analysis of perceptions and social constructions of risk, prevention policies and behaviors in the face of uncertainty.

Sociology of the family

  • Study of family forms, role transformations and intergenerational relationships in various contexts.

Sociology of sexuality

  • Approach to norms, representations and practices, in connection with social and cultural evolutions.

Sociology of social movements

  • Understanding collective mobilizations, their actors, strategies and impact on social change.
Data analysis for social sciences and biology
ENS Paris-Saclay 3 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 3 Period : Second semester Title : Data analysis for social sciences and biology Duration : 12 weeks Course hours : 3 hours per week, 36 hours per year Institution : ENS Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures + Tutorials Credits : 3 ECTS
Course description

This Data Analysis for Social Sciences and Biology course introduces fundamental data science methods adapted to the specific contexts of these disciplines. It covers data collection, cleaning, visualization and statistical analysis, with a focus on database exploitation and computer tools.

The course uses R and Python to develop students' analytical and programming skills.

Quantitative sociology
ENSAE Polytechnic Institute of Paris 2 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 3 Period : First semester Title : Quantitative sociology Duration : 12 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 24 hours per year Institution : Polytechnic Institute of Paris Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 2 ECTS
Course description

The objective of this course is to introduce students to the analysis of social phenomena from quantitative data. It combines sociological concepts and statistical tools to measure behaviors, inequalities and social dynamics.

Students learn to collect and process data, use analysis methods such as descriptive statistics and regression, and interpret results for concrete applications such as social mobility or inequalities.

Computational sociology
ENSAE Polytechnic Institute of Paris 2 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 3 Period : Second semester Title : Computational sociology Duration : 12 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 24 hours per year Institution : Polytechnic Institute of Paris Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 2 ECTS
Course description

This computational sociology course explores quantitative and computational methods applied to the study of social phenomena. It introduces fundamental concepts of modeling, social network analysis, and processing of large databases from human interactions.

The course emphasizes the use of digital tools for collecting, analyzing and visualizing social data.

Transversal block
L3 18 ECTS
Capstone Project
HEC Paris 12 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 3 Period : Throughout the year Title : Capstone Project Duration : 24 weeks Course hours : 6 hours per week, 144 hours per year Institution : HEC Paris Teaching method : Tutorials Credits : 12 ECTS
Course description

The Capstone project is a synthesis project that concludes the program. It allows students to mobilize all acquired skills to solve a concrete problem in data science. This project can take the form of in-depth data analysis, development of a predictive model or design of an innovative solution to address a real issue.

Carried out over several months, it promotes autonomy, creativity and practical application of statistical methods, programming and data visualization.

English
Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay 4 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 3 Period : Throughout the year Title : English Duration : 30 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 60 hours per year Institution : Lycée International de Palaiseau Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures Credits : 4 ECTS
Course description

This English course aims to consolidate and deepen the five language skills (oral and written comprehension, written expression, continuous oral expression and interaction) in an action-oriented approach. Emphasis is placed on fluency and precision, with work on pronunciation and intonation.

Activities are based on varied documents and collaborative projects around current themes such as environment, sustainable development and intercultural communication, to prepare students for professional and academic exchanges in an international context.

Culture / Sports / Second Language (LV2)
Université Paris-Saclay 2 ECTS
Year : Bachelor 3 Period : Throughout the year Title : Culture / Sports / Second Language (LV2) Duration : 24 weeks Course hours : 2 hours per week, 48 hours per year Institution : Université Paris-Saclay Teaching method : Lectures and/or Tutorials Credits : 2 ECTS
Course description

Physical, Sports and Artistic Activities of the student's choice or language teaching.
